item.title: how to use arduino on linux
item.description: Installing the arduino IDE goes like this: $ sudo dnf install arduino On Fedora linux the Arduino appears as a file. ls -l /dev/ttyACM0 # this returns: # crw-rw----. 1 root dialout 166, 0 Dec 19 18:43 /dev/ttyACM0 This means the “file” (the file representing the Arduino) is owned by root i.e. only root may manipulate it. In order for your current user to manipulate the Arduino we have to add “username” to the group “dialout”:
